item.title: Beogram 4000/4002/4004 Relays: Professionally Manufactured PCBs!
item.description:
I recently updated the design of the Beogram 4000/4002/4004 relay adapter boards to allow for professional manufacturing. I’ve begun taking and fulfilling orders with these new boards, and I’m thrilled with how they turned out. Here’s a look at the boards: These boards are compatible with both the older Siemens relays and the newer National relays commonly found as RPM and signal path grounding relays in the 400x series. They are designed as direct replacements for the original relays...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-400040024004-relays-professionally-manufactured-pcbs-/

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5521): Replacing the Electrolytic Capacitors, New Relays and New RPM Trimmers
item.description:
The Beogram 4002 on my workbench needed its electrolytic capacitors replaced. Given their age, I also replaced the tantalum capacitors, which are prone to failure due to their highly reactive electrodes. The following photo shows the main board before the replacements, with the tantalum capacitors visible as blue and red dots: As part of my standard restoration process, I replace the trimmers and relay in the DC motor’s RPM control circuit...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5521-replacing-the-electrolytic-capacitors-new-relays-and-new-rpm-trimmers/
